Sentencas: A single reversible solid oxide fuel cell (RSOFC) can perform dual functions: (1) as a solid oxide steam electrolyzer (SOSE) for hydrogen production and (2) as a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) for power generation.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Thus, RSOFC can potentially offer a low-cost approach to support hydrogen economy.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: A modeling study has been conducted to analyze the important concentration overpotentials in both SOSE and SOFC modes of operation.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The quantitative analyses show that in the SOSE mode, the hydrogen electrode is vulnerable to high concentration overpotential and limiting current density.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Oppositely, in the SOFC mode, the oxygen electrode is vulnerable to above problems.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: If the SOSE and SOFC modes are considered separately, a RSOFC should be oxygen-electrode-supported and hydrogen-electrode-supported, respectively.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: For this reason, comprehensive analysis is very important to optimize the structure of the electrode-support to maximize the overall efficiency of a RSOFC performing dual functions.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The modeling study signifies the difference between the SOSE and SOFC modes and provides insights in the operating mechanisms of RSOFC.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The present model can be further extended to conduct more simulations for design optimization.
Titulo: A modeling study on concentration overpotentials of a reversible solid oxide fuel cell
